message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper discusses erasure coding in the context of distributed storage systems, which is a topic that falls under several CS sub-categories. Information Theory (cs.IT) is the most likely category as erasure coding is a fundamental concept in information theory. Distributed Computing (cs.DC) and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) are also likely categories as the paper discusses the efficient repair of failed nodes in a distributed storage system. Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) are also possible categories as the paper discusses the amount of repair data transferred over the network and the number of helper nodes contacted.
